intro: Uragoga langsdorffiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions in South America and is often found in moist, tropical environments. Uragoga langsdorffiana is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain areas.
